				<item>
                    <title>This popular painkiller also kills kindness</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6551624-this-popular-painkiller-also-kills-kindness/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="Taking painkillers or any meds containing Acetaminophen can reduce a person’s capacity to empathize, a study has found." src="http://media.zuza.com/1/9/1995f11f-f280-4e6d-bdde-0cf938fb0e91/B822503377Z.1_20160512153203_000_G321M2V9J.1_Content.jpg" /><p>If your job, or simply your state of mind, depends on feeling empathy for others, you might want to reconsider reaching for the Tylenol the next time you have a headache.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:00:00 -0400 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6551624-this-popular-painkiller-also-kills-kindness/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>Five red flags that your ‘clean’ diet is going too far</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6551976-five-red-flags-that-your-clean-diet-is-going-too-far/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt=""Eating clean" is all about balance. When the foods you avoid outnumber the foods you eat, you've gone too far." src="http://media.zuza.com/4/3/43ea5bef-785a-49c2-b4f4-df82517f8bf9/B822503297Z.1_20160512142544_000_G321M2Q70.1_Content.jpg" /><p>I love kale sautéed in garlic and olive oil. It sounds crazy, but I’d choose this healthy snack over a bag of potato chips any day. </p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:00:00 -0400 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6551976-five-red-flags-that-your-clean-diet-is-going-too-far/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>The weird history of vitamin D — and what it actually has to do with sun</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6551263-the-weird-history-of-vitamin-d-and-what-it-actually-has-to-do-with-sun/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="Scientists aren’t sure exactly why vitamin D developed, but one theory is that it functioned as a kind of early sunscreen." src="http://media.zuza.com/0/a/0a07dcf2-3512-4dcd-afec-27364d120d9b/B822503146Z.1_20160512102342_000_G6A1M2P3O.2_Content.jpg" /><p>As you soak in rays of almost-summer sunshine, your thoughts may turn to vitamin D — because you probably know it has something to do with the sun. But do you actually know what it is?</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ News ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ WhatsOn ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:23:42 -0400 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[ Leigh Cowart  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6551263-the-weird-history-of-vitamin-d-and-what-it-actually-has-to-do-with-sun/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>Acetaminophen: This popular painkiller also kills kindness</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6550954-acetaminophen-this-popular-painkiller-also-kills-kindness/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="A new study has found Acetaminophen, the most common drug ingredient in the United States, can reduce a person’s capacity to empathize with another person’s pain, whether that pain is physical or emotional." src="http://media.zuza.com/0/4/041d8c35-c428-496c-830d-bcad14c4a94c/B822503048Z.1_20160512075356_000_G6A1M2NE9.2_Content.jpg" /><p>If your job, or simply your state of mind, depends on feeling empathy for others, you might want to reconsider reaching for the Tylenol the next time you have a headache.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ News ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 07:53:56 -0400 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[ Amy Ellis Nutt  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6550954-acetaminophen-this-popular-painkiller-also-kills-kindness/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>A study asks: Too much folic acid a cause of autism?</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6549374-a-study-asks-too-much-folic-acid-a-cause-of-autism-/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="A study suggests very high levels of folic acid in mothers' blood at the time of childbirth was linked to higher risk of their children developing autism." src="http://media.zuza.com/f/d/fd29fecd-1450-4336-b8b7-59e066d2a551/B822502392Z.1_20160511133302_000_GD61M206J.2_Content.jpg" /><p> For decades, pregnant women and women who may become pregnant have been advised to take folic acid to help prevent certain birth defects.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 00:00:00 -0400 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6549374-a-study-asks-too-much-folic-acid-a-cause-of-autism-/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>Wellness Events</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6549521-wellness-events/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description>What: Free low-impact workout for seniors that focuses on improving strength, balance and daily living skills. Improve your fitness while sitting in a chair. Proper footwear needed</p></description>

				<item>
                    <title>Wellness events</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6547041-wellness-events/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description>What: Free weekly opportunity to practice guided meditation </p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>

				<item>
                    <title>Good posture is the best defence against RSI</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6547240-good-posture-is-the-best-defence-against-rsi/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="Poor posture at work can force smaller muscles in the hand, wrist and neck to  easily become overloaded causing pain." src="http://media.zuza.com/6/8/682b9bf5-9f39-4f20-b0ed-9d41258151c9/B822500425Z.1_20160510133712_000_GG61M1BKN.2_Content.jpg" /><p>Back in the 1990s, I taught a course called “Meeting the Physical Demands of Work.” It was part of a government-funded program for people re-entering the workforce. Attendees learned things like resume writing and basic computer skills and my role was to help them be ready physically to withstand the changes coming in their lives.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 00:00:00 -0400 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6547240-good-posture-is-the-best-defence-against-rsi/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>Drug drop-off day is Saturday</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6545277-drug-drop-off-day-is-saturday/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description>The Halton Regional Police Service’s annual Prescription Drug Drop-Off Day is Saturday, May 14, between 10 a.m. and 3 p.m. People are encouraged to drop-off their old and unused prescription medication safely and confidentially at one of several locations in the Region of Halton: HRPS Headquarters, 1151 Bronte Rd., Oakville; HRPS 10 Division, 315 Queen St., Acton; Halton Hills Town Hall, 1 Halton Hills Dr., Halton Hills; Milton Sports Centre (rear lot), 605 Santa Maria Dr., Milton; Town Hall, 1225 Trafalgar Rd., Oakville; City of Burlington Operations Centre, 3330 Harvester Rd., Burlington.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 00:00:00 -0400 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6545277-drug-drop-off-day-is-saturday/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>E-cigarette poisonings surge in young children, study says</title>
                    <link> http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6545381-e-cigarette-poisonings-surge-in-young-children-study-says/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="E-cigarettes colourful cases and flavoured vapour can make them enticing to young children." src="http://media.zuza.com/a/b/ab534a0b-a7bf-4641-aadd-4bf35b8fd7be/B822499668Z.1_20160509120253_000_G8F1M0SMP.2_Content.jpg" /><p> Electronic cigarettes have sickened rising numbers of young children, a study of U.S. poison centre calls has found. Most cases involve swallowing liquid nicotine.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 00:00:00 -0400 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>http://www.thespec.com/living-story/6545381-e-cigarette-poisonings-surge-in-young-children-study-says/</guid>                        				
                </item>
